com.percussion.utils.timing
Class PSStopwatch

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.utils.timing.PSStopwatch

public class PSStopwatch
extends Object

A simple stopwatch class that simplifies timing things during testing. The class starts in a stopped state, and needs to have the various methods called to change the state. It is illegal to stop the stopwatch if it hasn't been started.

A stopwatch can be used multiple times as long as the state transitions are correct.

Note that on Windows, this class makes use of the hrtlib.dll. See the article at http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/javaqa/2003-01/01-qa-0110-timing.html#resources for a good discussion.

Constructor Detail

PSStopwatch

public PSStopwatch()
Create a new stopwatch object. Note that the object must be started in order to record time.

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Initialize the time in the stopwatch and change the state to running. The stopwatch must be in the stopped state before this method is called. The initial state of the stopwatch is stopped.

stop

public void stop()
Stop the stopwatch and record the end time. The stopwatch must be running or paused.

pause

public void pause()
Pause the stopwatch. This causes any time between the pause and a call to cont() to be disregarded in the reported time. A pause with no corresponding continue will act like a call to stop(), but the reported state will be paused. It is an error if the stopwatch is not running and not paused when this call is made. If the stopwatch is already paused then this call has no effect.

cont

public void cont()
Put the stopwatch back into a running state. This call has no effect if the stopwatch is already running. If it is paused, the time since the call to pause is calculated and summed with any previous paused times.

elapsed

public double elapsed()
Elapsed either returns the current elapsed time or the total time. If the stopwatch is stopped then elapsed uses the recorded time, otherwise it returns the elapsed time since start was called.

Returns:
elapsed time in millis

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object
